verses.verse: Then the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559>

"Speak<WH1696> to the sons<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> and get<WH3947> from them a rod<WH4294> for each father's household:<WH1004> twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> rods,<WH4294> from all<WH3605> their leaders<WH5387> according to their fathers' households.<WH1004> You shall write<WH3789> each<WH376> name<WH8034> on his rod,<WH4294>
and write<WH3789> Aaron's name<WH8034> on the rod<WH4294> of Levi;<WH3878> for there is one<WH259> rod<WH4294> for the head<WH7218> [of each] of their fathers' households.<WH1004>
"You shall then deposit<WH5117> them in the tent<WH168> of meeting<WH4150> in front<WH6440> of the testimony,<WH5715> where<WH834> <WH8033> I meet<WH3259> with you.

"And it will come<WH1961> about that the rod<WH4294> of the man<WH376> whom<WH834> I choose<WH977> will sprout.<WH6524> Thus I shall lessen<WH7918> from upon Myself the grumblings<WH8519> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> who<WH834> are grumbling<WH9235> against<WH5921> you."

Moses<WH4872> therefore spoke<WH1696> to the sons<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> and all<WH3605> their leaders<WH5387> gave<WH5414> him a rod<WH4294> apiece,<WH259> for each<WH259> leader<WH5387> according to their fathers' households,<WH1004> twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> rods,<WH4294> with the rod<WH4294> of Aaron<WH175> among<WH8432> their rods.<WH4294>
So Moses<WH4872> deposited<WH5117> the rods<WH4294> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068> in the tent<WH168> of the testimony.<WH5715>

Now it came<WH1961> about on the next<WH4283> day<WH4283> that Moses<WH4872> went<WH935> into the tent<WH168> of the testimony;<WH5715> and behold,<WH2009> the rod<WH4294> of Aaron<WH175> for the house<WH1004> of Levi<WH3878> had sprouted<WH6524> and put<WH3318> forth<WH3318> buds<WH6525> and produced<WH6692> blossoms,<WH6692> and it bore<WH1580> ripe<WH1580> almonds.<WH8247>

Moses<WH4872> then brought<WH3318> out all<WH3605> the rods<WH4294> from the presence<WH6440> of the Lord<WH3068> to all<WH3605> the sons<WH1121> of Israel;<WH3478> and they looked,<WH7200> and each<WH376> man<WH376> took<WH3947> his rod.<WH4294>

But the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> "Put<WH7725> back<WH7725> the rod<WH4294> of Aaron<WH175> before<WH6440> the testimony<WH5715> to be kept<WH4931> as a sign<WH226> against the rebels,<WH4805> that you may put<WH3615> an end<WH3615> to their grumblings<WH8519> against<WH4480> <WH5921> Me, so that they should not die.<WH4191>"
Thus Moses<WH4872> did;<WH6213> just<WH9201> as the Lord<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> him, so<WH3651> he did.<WH6213>
Then the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> spoke<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2005> we perish,<WH1478> we are dying, we are all<WH6> dying!
"Everyone<WH3605> who comes<WH7131> near,<WH7131> who comes<WH7131> near<WH7131> to the tabernacle<WH4908> of the Lord,<WH3068> must die.<WH4191> Are we to perish<WH1478> completely<WH8552>?"
